7x7.title: Math: Algebra Basics
pages: Page 1: What is algebra? Algebra is the study of variables and their relationships.
Page 2: Example: Solve for x: 2x + 3 = 7. Solution: x = 2.

5x2.title: History: World War II
pages: Page 1: World War II began in 1939 and ended in 1945.
Page 2: Key events: D-Day, Pearl Harbor, and the Holocaust.

5x5.title: Science: Photosynthesis
pages: Page 1: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight into energy.
Page 2: The chemical equation for photosynthesis is: 6CO₂ + 6H₂O → C₆H₁₂O₆ + 6O₂.

4x9.title: Literature: Shakespeare
pages: Page 1: William Shakespeare was an English playwright and poet.
Page 2: Famous works: Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet, and Macbeth.

3x3.title: Geography: Continents
pages: Page 1: There are 7 continents: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia.
Page 2: The largest continent is Asia, and the smallest is Australia.

2x0.title: Physics: Newton's Laws
pages: Page 1: Newton's First Law: An object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by an external force.
Page 2: Newton's Second Law: Force = mass × acceleration (F = ma).

1x4.title: Biology: Human Body
pages: Page 1: The human body has 11 major organ systems.
Page 2: Examples: Circulatory system, Nervous system, and Digestive system.

0x8.title: Chemistry: Periodic Table
pages: Page 1: The periodic table organizes elements by atomic number and properties.
Page 2: Example elements: Hydrogen (H), Oxygen (O), and Gold (Au).
